ValueDomain.preferredName: Physical Examination Test Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Name
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A character or string that represents the full name of the physical examination assessment._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: A character or string that represents the full name of the physical examination assessment.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What was the body system exam
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the body system examined?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsor should pre-populate CRF with all body systems to be examined. The use of a complete list of body systems eliminates the need for an other, specify category as any abnormalities identified should fall under one of the pre-specified categories. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Body System can be included as the column header.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PETEST; PETESTCD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable. The SDTMIG variable PETESTCD may be determined from the value collected in PETEST.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Per protocol, perform physical examinations of specified body systems.
